unnormalised: Okay, so last week I went to the local market, you know, the one near my house in Andheri. I wanted to make some good ol' sambar for dinner. The prices of everything are just going up and up! I remember when tomatoes used to be just Rs. 20/kg. Now? It's like ₹80 per kg minimum!
normalised: Okay, so last week I went to the local market, you know, the one near my house in Andheri. I wanted to make some good old sambar for dinner. The prices of everything are just going up and up! I remember when tomatoes used to be just rupees twenty per kilogram. Now? It's like rupee eighty per kilogram minimum!

unnormalised: First, I stopped at the vegetable vendor. I needed at least 1/2 kg of tomatoes, 250 gms of onions, and a small bunch of coriander. The vendor was quoting Rs. 30 for 100 gms of capsicum! I told him, "Bhaiyya, itna mehenga?" He just shrugged. Inflation, he said. I ended up buying only 200 g of capsicum just enough for the sambar.
normalised: First, I stopped at the vegetable vendor. I needed at least half kilogram of tomatoes, two hundred and fifty grams of onions, and a small bunch of coriander. The vendor was quoting rupees thirty for one hundred grams of capsicum! I told him, "Bhaiyya, itna mehenga?" He just shrugged. Inflation, he said. I ended up buying only two hundred grams of capsicum just enough for the sambar.

unnormalised: Next, I went to the grocery store. Needed some dal, of course. I usually buy the Tata Sampann toor dal. The 1 kg pack was priced at Rs. 140. I also picked up 1/4 kg of tamarind paste (Rs. 60) and a small bottle of sambar powder.
normalised: Next, I went to the grocery store. Needed some dal, of course. I usually buy the T-A-T-A Sampann toor dal. The one kilogram pack was priced at rupees one hundred and forty. I also picked up one fourth kilogram of tamarind paste rupees sixty and a small bottle of sambar powder.

unnormalised: Then came the surprise. I wanted to buy some rice. Normally, I buy 5 kgs of basmati rice. It was Rs. 450. Last month it was only Rs. 400! I asked the shopkeeper, "What happened?" He told me that due to the monsoon season, the supply has been affected.
normalised: Then came the surprise. I wanted to buy some rice. Normally, I buy five kilograms of basmati rice. It was rupees four hundred and fifty. Last month it was only rupees four hundred! I asked the shopkeeper, "What happened?" He told me that due to the monsoon season, the supply has been affected.

unnormalised: All in all, I ended up spending close to ₹1000 for a simple sambar meal! It's crazy how much prices have gone up, right? I guess I need to plan my meals more carefully and buy in bulk whenever possible. Maybe next time, I'll just make khichdi.
normalised: All in all, I ended up spending close to rupee one thousand for a simple sambar meal! It's crazy how much prices have gone up, right? I guess I need to plan my meals more carefully and buy in bulk whenever possible. Maybe next time, I'll just make khichdi.
